summary: The concept of "re-integration into school" pertains to the processes and measures aimed at facilitating the return of students, particularly those who have experienced disruptions in their education, to the formal education system. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this concept is crucial for ensuring inclusive education and equal opportunities for all learners. The EU promotes policies that support educational institutions in implementing effective re-integration strategies, which may include tailored support programs, counselling, and collaboration with social services. Such initiatives are vital for fostering an equitable educational environment and enhancing overall academic performance within the EU member states.
